newsitem.title: UK: Allied Domecq down as demerger hopes fade.
newsitem.headline: Allied Domecq down as demerger hopes fade.

text.p: Shares in Allied Domecq Plc dropped on Monday after press reports that the company had ruled out a demerger of its spirits business.
The stock, which on Friday touched its highest level in six months, was quoted down 16p at 468-1/2 by 0813 GMT.
A report in the Financial Times said anyone hoping for a dramatic restructuring or demerger would be disappointed and added that the company's results later this week would be weak.

The paper said Allied's pre-tax profit were likely to drop to about 570 million stg from 645 million a year before, weighed down by continued destocking by distributors particularly in the U.S. and Europe, residual problems over the devaluation of the Mexican peso and continued tough trading conditions.
